key_points: Alaska Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski acknowledges her vote to convict Trump could have political consequences.
Murkowski emphasizes her obligation to support the Constitution over party loyalty.
The Alaska Republican Party earlier opposed the Senate impeachment trial as 'moot' and a conviction.
Murkowski was one of seven Republican senators who voted to convict Trump.
Senators Richard Burr and Bill Cassidy, who also voted to convict Trump, have been censured by their state party officials.
Murkowski is considering running for reelection next year.
Alaska's voting system has been changed to allow ranked-choice voting for general elections.
Murkowski asserts her record of independence and party-bucking behaviors.
She believes the Republican Party can be good post-Trump but is currently trying to find its identity.
Murkowski identifies as a Republican but not a 'Trump Republican.'
